title: Executive Order 13383-Amending Executive Orders 12139 and 12949 in Light of Establishment of the Office of Director of National Intelligence
content: By the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and the laws of the United States of America, it is hereby ordered as follows:
Section. 1. Section 1–103 of Executive Order 12139 of May 23, 1979, is amended by:

Sec. 3. This order is not intended to, and does not, create any right or benefit, substantive or procedural, enforceable by any party at law or in equity against the United States, its departments, agencies, entities, officers, employees, or agents, or any other person. George W. Bush
[Filed with the Office of the Federal Register, 8:45 a.m., July 19, 2005]
citation: George W. Bush, Executive Order 13383-Amending Executive Orders 12139 and 12949 in Light of Establishment of the Office of Director of National Intelligence Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/217525
